revision.text:
{{WPMILHIST|class=Start <!-- B-Class 5-criteria checklist --> <!-- B-Class-1. It is suitably referenced, and all major points have appropriate inline citations. --> |B1=no <!-- B-Class-2. It reasonably covers the topic, and does not contain obvious omissions or inaccuracies. --> |B2=yes <!-- B-Class-3. It has a defined structure, including a lead section and one or more sections of content. --> |B3=yes <!-- B-Class-4. It is free from major grammatical errors. --> |B4=yes <!-- B-Class-5. It contains appropriate supporting materials, such as an infobox, images, or diagrams. --> |B5=yes |WWII=yes|German=yes}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=start|importance=high}}
Shouldn't this page have an English title, rather than a German one? Something like German Armed Forces High Command? I think that's the Wikipedia naming convention. [[user:jheijmans|jheijmans]]
: While this is the general Wikipedia policy, I don't think it's justified in this case, as OKW is a the term used in most professional literature. Therefore, it appears to me that choosing the less known and less easily identifiable name is a disservice to Wikipedia. After all, if we don't translate such proper names as [[Entscheidungsproblem]], I see no reason why we should translate OKW. --[[user:Uriyan|Uriyan]]
OK, I didn't know OKW was an accepted term (though I know words like Wehrmacht and Luftwaffe are - translating them will also be rather meaningless: "Army" and "Airforce"). [[user:jheijmans|jheijmans]]
: Right. In fact, as response to the first comment, I was going to name specifically ''Luftwaffe''. ''Kriegsmarine'' is another good example. In any case, as Uriyan said, it is the proper example. Also, take note of all the links on the other-language Wikipedias. They all link to another page of the exact same name (except the link to the Georgian one). [[User:D. F. Schmidt|D. F. Schmidt]] 01:23, 14 January 2006 (UTC)
: Regardless it needs translations within the texts. I prefer to see the english, with the German in parens, and even if it's wikilinked to a German title, use the english name. But it is a good start. [[User:Auntieruth55|Auntieruth55]] ([[User talk:Auntieruth55|talk]]) 00:38, 26 September 2009 (UTC)
